alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Kennebec; Sagadahoc; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kennebec, southern Oxford, Androscoggin, northwestern Cumberland and northwestern Sagadahoc Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Turner to Mechanic Falls to near Bridgton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Conway, Gardiner, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Naples, Turner, Topsham, Gray, Litchfield, Farmingdale, Manchester, Hallowell, Hiram, Raymond, Winthrop, Lisbon, Greene and Durham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 38 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 63 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Kennebec; Sagadahoc; Southern Oxford
